marklogic.body: Lookit - I love the wild mustangs, am owner of 2, but the slant of this article infuriates me. The horses were NOT living in squallor. Yes, the mud was deep WHERE YOU WERE FILMING, but if you noted early in the film clip, there are high Spots in the enclosure, way up the hill, and a lot of it, that you just KNOW dry out faster that it does down were the horses were being filmed. Was this right after a huge rain? Days of rain? Anyone that has any honesty to them will have to admit that THEIR own pastures sometimes look like this. I've had horses for 30+ years, and we've periodically had paddocks/areas of pastures that look exactly like this. Not , not even often, but periodically. I resent the slant and sensationalism that is inserted into this argument on this side, because ALL IT DOES IS NEGATE ANY LOGICAL, COGENT ARGUMENT THAT IS MADE. Logical arguments are quickly tossed onto the pile of 'over-the-top' arguments that are often so often slung around. I read stuff like this, I want to defend the BLM only because this accusation is so absurd. <shakes head> Think before you write creative prose and try to pass it Off as levelheaded facts.
